I thank my fellow co-chairs, Representatives Neguse, Issa, and Calvert, for their leadership. Bipartisan work will save lives.

Finally, I'm thrilled to have secured more than $13 Million for Berks and Montgomery Counties in the 2023 budget. This community project funding will bring resources to 15 local projects that address urgent needs in our communities - from education to healthcare to infrastructure and more.

I've been working with [[user]] for years. A friendly, passionate, hardworking man — anything but threatening. Representative Greene is the aggressor here — pushing an age-old, racist trope used to target and discredit Black men. We see through it. [[url]]

Republicans say that Democrats just want to ban guns — that we won't address the people who commit acts of gun violence or acknowledge mental health as a factor. As you can see, we're taking many different approaches. Republicans simply aren't interested in acting at all. [[url]]

For the 118th Congress, I'm grateful to continue serving on the House Judiciary Committee - and will soon being serving on the House Foreign Affairs Committee . I'm ready to work for the common good, both at home and abroad, and will do so with our communities in mind.

Legislative Update January 5th marked one year since the horrific fire in Philadelphia that claimed the lives of three sisters and nine of their children. Yesterday, I joined the National Fallen Firefighters Foundation and the US Fire Administration to remember this tragedy - and to share information about my and Senator Bob Casey's Public and Federally Assisted Housing Fire Safety Act that requires hardwired or tamper-resistant battery-powered smoke alarms in federally assisted housing so that we can better protect families in public housing.
